answerText: Flaubert's Parrot[10] Flaubert's Parrot was written by this English author of The Sense of an Ending and England, England.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Harvard A and Virginia B | 12 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The narrator of this novel sees the first candidate for the title object in a museum at the Hotel-Dieu, and the second at a converted house-museum in Croisset. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel in which Geoffrey Braithwaite tries to identify the original of a stuffed animal named Loulou. This essentially plotless novel includes long digressions about Geoffrey's deceased wife.
